Eligibility: - An analyzable mass per patient: BI-RADS 3 and 4a, 4b, 4c and 5 mass declared by the clinical investigator through the criteria for inclusion of the PIONEER study and classified as BIRADS 3, 4a, 4b 4c and 5 by conventional diagnostic ultrasound (CDU)
Reported masses in PIONEER population Intention to Diagnose (ITD)/Analysis, including high risk cases by original PIONEER protocol
Age of the patient, indication for entry into the study and medical history available
The evaluable mammograms and the OA and IUS video loops and the stills for each mass
There is a lack of images and/or video loops or motionless and incorrect IUS or OA video loops that would prevent a case from being evaluated by the players.
Reviewer-02 Competency Test and Training Cases
Results: The main efficacy criterion was the difference (gain) in specificity (fSp) at a fixed sensitivity of 98% for IMS+OA versus IUS alone, of the 15 independent readers; the two imaging methods used for each subject (subject as own control); the results for each imaging modality compared to the biopsy diagnosis or the 12-month benign follow-up decision according to the truth panel (ground truth).
Description of the arm/group: IUS Imagery alone
Unit of measure: % benign masses+TPB correctly identified 38.22 (24.85 to 51.59)
Description of the arm/group: IUS+OA Imagery
Unit of measure: % benign masses+TPB correctly identified 47.20 (35.91 to 58.49)
